properties.areaDesc: Western Grant; Western Highland; Western Pendleton
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 4 at 9:40PM EST until January 5 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West
Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties.

* WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 AM EST Sunday.The heaviest
snow is most likely from 9 PM this evening until 3 AM
overnight into early Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered and slippery roads through
Sunday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong northwest winds will average
between 20 and 30 mph with gusts around 40 to 50 mph. The
combination of strong winds along with snow and blowing snow
will reduce visibility to below one-half mile at times, making
travel difficult overnight into early Sunday morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on
steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery,
increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY
